items.message:
High river levels today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 21 December 2025 . 
River levels on the Bristol Avon, Tetbury Avon, Sherston Avon and Dauntsey Brook remain high but are slowly dropping today, Sunday the 21th December 2025. Limited rain expected today so we are not expecting flood warning thresholds to be reached to be met today. The weather outlook shows further showers next week but no significant rainstorms. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses .Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded 
This message will be updated by 11:50AM on 22 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Trent from Cromwell Weir to Gainsborough
items.message:
High tides tonight and tomorrow may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible. Areas most at risk are Church Laneham to Rampton Road. Light rainfall is forecast over the next 12 hours. River levels at Torksey Gauge continue to rise slowly and pose a flood risk to low-lying areas and roads. Levels will remain high until 25/12/25.

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water & avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses. This message will be updated by 09:00 on 22 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Slash Lane at Sileby and the Mountsorrel to Sileby road and Sileby Mill road, and farmlands at Cossington, Sileby, Barrow, Quorndon and Cotes. Light rainfall is forecast this evening and overnight, 21/12/2025. River levels at Pillings Lock Gauge have peaked, but levels remain high, and forecast rainfall could cause a further rise in levels. Levels will remain high until 23 December 2025. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 9:00 on 21 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Churn, Hilcot Brook, Daglingworth Stream, Gumstool Brook

items.message:
High river levels may lead to flooding. Flooding remains possible.

Flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue today, 21 December 2025, river levels along the River Churn remain high, particularly in South Cerney and Cerney Wick. 

The forecast is for further rain and showers today and overnight becoming mostly dry by Monday. We expect river levels to remain high over the next few days but levels are starting to stabilise. 

We are closely monitoring the situation. 

Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.

This message will be updated by 09:00am 22 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message:
Rising river levels today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 21st December 2025. 
This information is correct as of 15:45 on Sunday 21st December. The causeway at Sutton Gault has approximately 10 centimetre of water on the road. There are currently no issues on the Welney or Earith causeway. Due to uneven surface of the roads, water may be deeper in places.  
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. 
This message will be updated by 08:00 on Monday 22nd December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message:
High river levels may lead to flooding.

Flooding of low lying land and roads remains possible today, 21 December 2025. River level on the Swill Brook are still high in the Oaksey area but are falling slowly.  River levels have now fallen on the River Key in Purton Stoke. 

The forecast is for further rain and showers today and overnight becoming mostly dry by Monday. We expect river levels to remain high and responsive to further rain over the coming days.

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. 

This message will be updated by 09:00am 22 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
If you have been evacuated only return to your property once the emergency services have advised that it is safe to do so. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

River levels are still high but are falling slowly on the Lower Frome. Flooding may still be affecting low lying areas near to the River Frome in the Dorchester, West Stafford, Bockhampton, Lewell, Tincleton, Pallington, Waddock, Moreton, Wool, East Stoke, Holmebridge, Stoborough, Stoborough Green, Wareham, Redcliffe, Ridge and Swineham areas. No significant rain is forecast for today. We will continue to monitor the forecast. Please avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. People in this area should take action now and watch your local weather forecast. This message will be updated by 03:00 PM on 22 December 2025, or as the situation changes.

River levels remain high. Flooding is possible on 21 December 2025. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the River Lugg south of Leominster from Stoke Prior to Mordiford. Other locations that may be affected include Bodenham, Lugwardine and Hampton Bishop. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message:
Tide locking where high tides restrict normal drainage of the river out to sea, today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible today Sunday 21st December 2025 and over the next few days. 

We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry Road in Horning.  River levels will remain high over the next few days.
We are closely monitoring the situation.   
Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.   

This message will be updated by by 10:00 on Monday 22nd December 2025, or as the situation changes. 
Flooding is possible today Sunday 21st December 2025 and over the next few days.

items.description: River Yeo and River Parrett Moors around Muchelney and Thorney
items.message:
Water levels are falling but remain high on the Rivers Yeo and Parrett. With a few showers forecast this evening.
Low lying land and roads are expected to be most affected by flooding. Flooding will affect the road from Langport to Muchelney if the drain level at Huish Episcopi pumping station exceeds 7.3m; the road from Muchelney to Long Load above 7.86m; Muchelney to Thorney above 7.93m and Muchelney to Drayton above 8.8m. Property flooding is possible above 8.35m. For the latest river and drain levels refer to https://check-for-flooding.service.gov.uk/river-and-sea-levels.
Refer to Somerset Council’s website for any local road closures.
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. And we are pumping and operating the Parrett Relief Channel when river levels allow.
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.
This message will be updated by 12:00 PM on 22 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels have started to fall but remain high, therefore the risk of flooding continues on 21 December and over the next few days. Locations that may be affected include Apperley, Maisemore, Hempstead, Minsterworth Ham and Quedgeley. Severn Ham, Tewkesbury starts to fill. Predicted peaks:- Mythe peaked at 4.13m on 21/12, Haw Bridge peaked at 4.97m 21/12. Further rainfall is forecast on Sunday. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 22 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by10:00AM on 22 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message:
High river levels overnight may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from the evening of 21 December 2025 . 
Rivers remain high following rain this week, further rain is forecast throughout Sunday and overnight into Monday. 

Flooding is possible for low lying land and roads around rivers in Hayle, Perranporth, Penzance, Newlyn, Crowlas, Porthleven, St Ives, Camborne and Portreath 

The main areas of concern are low lying areas along the River Hayle. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 22 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Flooding is possible from Sunday 21st to Monday 22nd December. 

Rivers remain high following rain this week, further rain is forecast throughout Sunday and overnight into Monday.

Flooding is possible for low lying land and roads around rivers in Pentewan, St Blazey, Luxulyan and Mevagissey.

We are closely monitoring the situation.

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.

This message will be updated by 11AM on 22nd December.

There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Further rainfall is forecast but no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals.

There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

High river levels today may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on 21 December 2025. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from the Welsh border at Llawnt to Shrawardine near Shrewsbury. Other locations that may be affected include Llanymynech, Maesbrook and Melverley. Roads between Maesbrook, Melverley and Pentre start to flood. Observed peaks:- Llanymynech peaked at 4.23m 18/12 AM, Cae Howel 4.25m on 21/12 AM. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 22 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
If you have been evacuated only return to your property once the emergency services have advised that it is safe to do so. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
If you have been evacuated only return to your property once the emergency services have advised that it is safe to do so. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.

floodArea.riverOrSea: Sandyford Brook, Ridings Brook, Saredon Brook

items.message:
River levels remain above flood alert thresholds but are falling slowly. Consequently the risk of flooding remains.
 Flooding may affect low-lying land and roads adjacent to the River Sow between Great Bridgeford and Shugborough, the River Penk between Coven and Stafford, the Sandyford Brook, the Rising Brook, the Ridings Brook and the Saredon Brook.
We expect river levels to remain above flood alert thresholds into Tuesday, 23/12/25.
We are closely monitoring the situation .
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses . Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.
This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 22 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels continue to remain high and may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible for: Lower Rivers Tone and Parrett including West Moor, Hay Moor, Curry Moor, Stan Moor, Salt Moor and North Moor. The River Tone level at Currymoor pumping station remains high (currently 7.48m). Water is entering Currymoor reservoir via Hookbridge spillway as this level exceeds 7.45m. The drain level at Currymoor pumping station is 6.61m. Cutts Road floods when the drain level at Currymoor pumping station is above 5.75m, and New Road when the level is above 6.18m. Please refer to the latest gauge levels on Check for Flooding and Somerset Council’s website for information on road closures in the area. Showers are forecast this evening. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Pumping will commence at Currymoor when river levels allow. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 22 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
If you have been evacuated only return to your property once the emergency services have advised that it is safe to do so. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

River levels have started to fall but remain high, therefore the risk of flooding continues on 21 December and over the next few days. Flooding may affect low lying land & roads adjacent to the river from Highley to Tewkesbury; including Dog Lane Bewdley, Stourport, Diglis & Hylton Road towpath. Flooded drains affect the racecourse & Worcester CCG. PLP should be installed. New St Gate closed at Upton upon Severn. Predicted peaks:- Bewdley peaked at 3.02m 21/12, Worcester peaked at 4.14 20/12, Diglis peaked at 3.91m 20/12, Kempsey Yacht Club peaked 6.03m on 21/12, Saxons Lode peaked at 4.68 21/12. Further rainfall is forecast Sunday 21/12. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 22 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels have started to fall but remain high, therefore the risk of flooding continues on 21 December and over the next few days. Flooding may affect low lying land and Squires Walk in the area of the Hatfield Brook Kempsey.  Kempsey Flood Alleviation Scheme is operational. Predicted peak:- Kempsey Yacht Club peaked at 6.03m 20/12. Further rainfall is forecast Sunday. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.  This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 22 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

High river levels today may lead to flooding. Flooding continues to pose a risk. Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Willington, Barrow upon Trent, Swarkestone, Bargate Lane, and the access roads to Willington Meadows, the Twyford Village access road, Church Lane at Barrow, and Ingleby Lane. Further rainfall is forecast overnight. River levels at Shardlow Gauge and Willington Gauge remain high. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water & avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses. This message will be updated by 09:00 on 22 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Ouse, Burdyke, Holgate Beck, Blue Beck, River Foss, The Fleet

items.message:
River levels remain high following recent rainfall. As a result, flooding is possible today, Sunday 21st December 2025 and overnight. 

Locations most affected will be riverside footpaths and low-lying land in York and to the south as far as Naburn Lock, including Kings Staith, Queens Staith, and South Esplanade. 

Levels are expected to fall slowly over the next few days. We are monitoring the forecast and river levels and liaising with emergency services and local authorities. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Consider acting on your flood plan if you have one.

This message will be updated by 8:00AM on Monday 22nd December 2025, or as the situation changes.

High river levels today may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on 21 December 2025. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent the river from Shrewsbury to Upper Arley. Locations that may be affected are White Abbey, Coalbrookdale, Ironbridge and Bridgnorth. River Severn bankfull at White Abbey, floodplain may be filling at Hayes Basin. Observed peaks:- Crew Green peaked at 5.48m on 19/12 AM, Montford at 4.5m 19/12 AM, Welshbridge at 2.41m on 19/12 AM, Buildwas 3.72m on 19/12 PM, Bridgnorth 3.02m on 20/12 AM. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 22 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message: River levels have started to fall but remain high, therefore flooding is expected to continue on 21 December and over the next few days. Predicted peak:- Mythe peaked at 4.13m on 21/12 AM.  We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Monitor local water levels and weather conditions.  This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 22 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

Never drive through flood water, just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car . This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 22 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
If you have been evacuated only return to your property once the emergency services have advised that it is safe to do so. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

Flooding may affect properties and roads in and around Tirley and Chaceley, including the B4213 Church Road and B4213 Haw Bridge Road at Wainlodes Junction. Haw Bridge peaked at 4.97m 21/12/AM. We are closely monitoring the situation .This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 22 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Severn at Abbots Court, Deerhurst
items.message: River levels have started to fall but remain high, therefore flooding is expected to continue on 21 December and over the next few days. Flooding may affect Abbots Court, Deerhurst. Haw Bridge peaked at 4.97m 21/12 AM. We are closely monitoring the situation. This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 22 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Groundwater flooding in the West of Dorset
items.message: High and rising groundwater levels may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible in the West Dorset area. Groundwater levels are rising in response to recent heavy rainfall. Levels may continue to rise and flooding of fields and roads is possible. Further rainfall is expected over the next few days which may see levels continue to rise. Where groundwater is near the surface, intense rainfall will lead to surface water flooding. We are closely monitoring the situation . Residents are advised to prepare property resilience measures and ensure that pumps are working where they have been installed. This message will be updated by 4:00PM on 23 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Brathay, River Rothay, River Winster

items.message: River and lake levels remain high today, Sunday 21 December 2025. Further rainfall is expected overnight tonight into Monday 22 December 2025. Lake levels will continue to fall today 21 December 2025 but may rise overnight in response to the rainfall. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near the rivers Brathay, Rothay, Winster and other watercourses from Grasmere to Grange-over-Sands including low lying areas around Ambleside, Skelwith Bridge, Windermere, Hawkshead, Newby Bridge, Backbarrow, Cark and Cartmel. We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths, bridges near local watercourses and do not drive through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00 am on Monday 22nd December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Groundwater flooding in the Cranborne Chase area
items.message:
High groundwater levels may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from the 21 December 2025 onwards 
Groundwater levels have risen in response to recent rainfall. Levels are expected to continue to rise and flooding of fields and roads is possible. Levels are reactive to further rainfall. Flooding of roads and fields is possible. Where groundwater is near the surface, intense rainfall will lead to surface water flooding. Residents are advised to prepare property resilience measures and ensure that pumps are working where they have been installed. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Residents are advised to prepare property resilience measures and ensure that pumps are working where they have been installed . 
This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 24 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
High river levels overnight may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from the evening of 21 December 2025 . 
Rivers remain high following rain this week, further rain is forecast throughout Sunday and overnight into Monday.

Flooding is possible for low lying land and roads along the River Cober including Trenear, Coverack Bridges, Lowertown, Sithney Green, Helston and the Loe Valley.

We have staff operating culverts to reduce water levels in Loe Pool. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 22 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message:
Flooding is possible from Sunday 21st to Monday 22nd December.  

Rivers remain high following rain this week, further rain is forecast throughout Sunday and overnight into Monday. 
 
Flooding is possible for low lying land and roads around the River Seaton, Looe rivers, and the River Pol. 
 
We are closely monitoring the situation.     

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.   

This message will be updated by 11AM on 22nd December.

River levels have levelled off but remain high due to the recent heavy rainfall. Flooding of roads and low lying land is possible. Flooding could still affect locations near the River Piddle, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around tributaries between Alton Pancras and Wareham. There is no significant rain forecast for today. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Consider activating any flood protection products you may have and monitor local water levels and weather conditions. This message will be updated by 03:00 PM on 22 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Avon at Strensham and Bredon
items.message:

Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.description: Clanfield Brook for Clanfield Village and the Shill Brook for Bampton
items.message:
High river levels may lead to flooding. 

Flooding of low lying land and roads remains possible today, 21 December 2025. River levels are still high but falling slowly on the Clanfield Brook, especially in the Clanfield area. River levels have now fallen on the Shill Brook in Bampton. 

The forecast is for further rain and showers today and overnight becoming mostly dry by Monday. River levels high but are falling and remain responsive to further rain over the coming days.

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. 

This message will be updated by 09:00am 22 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Lower River Loddon at the River Thames confluence at Twyford
items.message:
High river levels this evening may lead to flooding. 

Flooding is possible on 21 December 2025.

Flooding of low lying land and roads is possible, especially in the Twyford area. This is in response to the rainfall over the last few days. Further light rainfall is forecast overnight. We expect river levels to remain high over the next few days.

We are closely monitoring the situation. 

Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.

This message will be updated by 10:00 22 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Lower Frome from East Stoke to Wareham
items.message: River levels remain high from previous heavy rainfall but are going down gradually. Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Lower Dorset Frome, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around areas in East Stoke, Holmebridge, Stoborough, Stoborough Green, Wareham, Redcliffe, Ridge and Swineham . River levels are continuing to fall. There is very little rainfall expected today. We are closely monitoring the situation . Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 22 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

High water levels are expected to cause flooding today. Flooding is expected on 21 December 2025 as river levels remain high. Flooding may affect locations near the River Tone, Currymoor Main Drain (currently at 6.6m), with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected. Cutts Road floods when the Currymoor Main Drain is above 5.75m, and New Road as this level is above 6.18m. There is a risk of water overtopping Haymoor flood storage area and affecting Curload and Stan Moor if this level reaches 8.30m. For the latest river and drain levels refer to https://check-for-flooding.service.gov.uk/river-and-sea-levels. River Parrett levels are being managed using the Parrett relief channel. Showers forecast this evening but drier weather forecast for the next few days. We are closely monitoring the situation and operating our pumping stations when river levels allow. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Refer to @TravelSomerset for information on local road closures. This message will be updated by 10AM on 22 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message: River levels remain high, however we're expecting levels to gradually fall throughout today. Flooding is possible.  Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. Our forecasts indicate that flooding to properties isn't likely and therefore flood warnings are not expected to be issued. We are closely monitoring the situation.  Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Avoid low lying roads near rivers which may be flooded. This message will be updated by 1pm on 22nd December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Thames from Shepperton to Molesey

floodArea.county: Greater London, Richmond upon Thames, Surrey

items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Further rainfall is forecast but no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals.

The river levels in the Eastern Yar will be steadily falling over the next 24 hours. Ditches around Fort Holiday Park will struggle to drain while river levels are high. Only a small amount of rain is forecast over the next 5 days. River levels and flood risk will continue to reduce over the next 24 hours. No new flooding impacts are expected in Alverstone. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and will ensure the river is kept free of reported blockages. Avoid low lying roads which may be flooded. This message will be updated by 12:00 on 22/12/2025.

The River Arun at Pulborough is slowly falling, but minor flooding will continue to affect fields, and the gardens of properties on Lower Street and Swan Corner, Pulborough and Bridge Cottages, Greatham. The next three tides (12:00 21/12/2025, 00:15 22/12/2025, and 12:30 22/12/2025) are forecast to be very similar, and only 10cm lower than Saturday morning's. We therefore expect river levels at Houghton Bridge to peak similar, but a little lower than Saturday through to Tuesday 23/12/2025, when water levels should fall further. Water will be high up banks near Houghton Bridge, Amberley and near St Edmunds Cottage, Houghton. Flood impacts in Arundel are not expected. Only a small amount of rain is forecast Sunday afternoon, then almost no rain next week. River levels and flood risk should slowly reduce over the next five days. However, river levels will remain higher than normal until the middle of next week. Our staff are on site at Pulborough with a temporary pump. Keep flood protection products installed in Pulborough and Amberley. This message will be updated by 15:00 22/12/2025.

Rising river levels may lead to flooding. 

Flooding of low lying land and roads  remains possible today, 21 December 2025,  especially in the Fosse Bridge and Bibury areas. 

The forecast is for further rain and showers today and overnight becoming mostly dry by Monday. We expect river levels to remain high and responsive to further rain over the coming days. 

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.

This message will be updated by 09:00am 22 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near the River Foulness and the Market Weighton Canal and their tributaries, particularly around Welham Bridge. 

Levels are expected to fall slowly over the next few days. Levels may rise following additional rainfall overnight. We are monitoring the forecast and river levels and liaising with emergency services and local authorities. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. 

This message will be updated by 8:00AM on Monday 22nd December 2025, or as the situation changes.

Lake levels will continue to fall today 21 December 2025 but may rise overnight in response to the rainfall. Locations most affected will be Keswick Campsite, with flooding from the lake. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Take particular care if walking around the lake shore. This message will be updated by 10:00 am on Monday 22 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels remain high on the River Derwent. As a result, flooding is expected today, Sunday 21st December 2025 and overnight.

Locations most affected will be Buttercrambe Mill at Buttercrambe Bridge. Levels are expected to remain high for a few days and fall slowly.

We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water and start acting on your flood plan if you have one.
 
This message will be updated by 08:00AM on Monday 22nd December 2025 or as the situation changes.

Locations most affected will be riverside footpaths and low-lying land and property in Stamford Bridge. 
Levels are expected to remain high and fall slowly over the next few days. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Please activate your flood plan. 

This message will be updated by 08:00AM on Monday 22nd December 2025 or as the situation changes.

Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. Our forecasts indicate that flooding to properties isn't likely and therefore flood warnings are not expected to be issued. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Avoid low lying roads, near rivers which may be flooded. This message will be updated by 1pm on the 22nd December 2025 or as the situation changes.

We are closely monitoring the situation.  Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Avoid low lying roads, near rivers which may be flooded This message will be updated by 1pm on the 22nd December 2025 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Hull, Holderness Drain, Barmston Drain

items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger.

items.description: River Great Ouse from Thornborough to Newport Pagnell
items.message:
High river levels today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 21st December 2025. 
Areas most at risk are those around the River Great Ouse from Thornborough to Newport Pagnell, including Dogsmouth Brook.   We are not expecting the situation to escalate, or to issue any further warning messages at this time.
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. 
This message will be updated by 10:00 on Monday 22nd December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Yeo and Parrett, Yeovilton to Huish Episcopi
items.message:
Water levels are falling but remain high on the Rivers Yeo and Parrett. With a few showers forecast this evening.
Low lying land and roads are expected to be most affected by flooding, particularly around the A37 south and A303 south west of Ilchester, the Ilchester to Limington road and road to Ilchester Meads. There is also a risk of flooding at Hainbury Mill, Ilchester.
Please refer to the latest gauge levels on Check for Flooding and Somerset Council’s website for information on road closures in the area.
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. And we are pumping when river levels allow.
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.
This message will be updated by 12:00 PM on 22 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Groundwater flooding in the Cerne Valley
items.message:
High groundwater levels are expected to cause flooding. 
Flooding is expected from the 19th December onwards. 
Groundwater levels in West Dorset remain high. Areas that could be affected include: Charminster and nearby areas. The groundwater level at the Dickley Down borehole has risen to 170m, and is expected to rise over the next few days. Residents are advised to prepare property resilience measures and ensure that pumps are working where they have been installed. Residents may experience inundation of septic tanks and sewer systems. Flooding of roads is expected, and may have become damaged by floodwater.

Where groundwater is near the surface, intense rainfall will lead to surface water flooding. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
If you have a pump, make sure it is working and switched on. Think about alternative power sources in case of power cuts . 
This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 24 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Groundwater flooding for the South Winterbourne Valley
items.message:
High groundwater levels are expected to cause flooding. 
Flooding is expected from 20th December 2025 onwards 
Groundwater levels in West Dorset remain high. Areas that could be affected include: Winterbourne Abbas, Winterbounre Steepleton, Martinstown, Winterborne Monkton, Winterbourne Herringston and Winterborne Came. The groundwater level at the Kingston Russell borehole has risen to 116.7m, and is expected to continue rising in next few days. Residents may experience inundation of septic tanks and sewer systems. Properties may experience flooding in cellars in affected areas. Flooding of roads is expected, Roads may be damaged by floodwater. intense rainfall will lead to surface water flooding. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
If you have a pump, make sure it is working and switched on. Think about alternative power sources in case of power cuts . 
This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 24 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
The Flood Warning has now been removed. However, a Flood Alert remains in force for the wider area, so flooding of roads and low lying land is still possible. 
Further rainfall is forecast but no further flooding is expected.  
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger.
